http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/descript.@value: IRRIG is an Irrigation Ontology for experimentation in TSCF, Irstea Clermont-Fd.

http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/title.@value: Irrigation ontology for experimentation in TSCF

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Actuator_WateringValve_01_Soil_Moisture - an actuator controls the valve of a watering device n° 01. The actuator indirectly affects soil moisture.
AmountProperty - Amount aspect of an entity representing the quantity of the entity.

Boundary_Rain_Quantity_High - a boundary line of division between two states of Rain Intensity: Heavy and Moderate.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rain quantity high is 40mm.

Boundary_Rain_Quantity_Low  - a boundary line of division between two states of Rain Intensity: Moderate and Light.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rain quantity low is 10mm.

Boundary_Rain_Quantity_Maximum - a boundary line represents the maximal value that rain quantity cannot surpass.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rain quantity maximum is 71.8mm.

Boundary_Rain_Quantity_Maximum - a boundary line represents the minimal value that rain quantity cannot surpass.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rain quantity minimum is 0mm.

Boundary_RootZone_Tension_Average - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: Low and Average.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension average is 140cbar.

Boundary_RootZone_Tension_High - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: Average and High.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension high is 120cbar

Boundary_RootZone_Tension_Low - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: VeryLow and Low.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension low is 150cbar

Boundary_RootZone_MoistureLevel_Maximum - a boundary line represents the maximal value that RootZone Tension cannot surpass.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension maximum is 200cbar

Boundary_RootZone_MoistureLevel_Minimum - a boundary line represents the minimal value that RootZone Tension cannot surpass.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension minimum is 0cbar

Boundary_RootZone_Tension_Saturation - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: VeryHigh and Saturated.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension saturation is 10cbar

Boundary_RootZone_Tension_VeryHigh - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: High and VeryHigh.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension very high is 70cbar

Boundary_RootZone_Tension_VeryLow - a boundary line of division between two states of RootZone MoistureLevel: Dry and VeryLow.

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the value of boundary rootzone tension very low is 160cbar

CropGrowthDeduction - a defined class represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate a State of the irrig:ObservableProperty_Crop_Growth of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Crop. The Observation may be performed by an inference engine. Links to a State to describe what the result is. Links to a TemporalEntity to indicate when the result is valid and for how many time.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A CropGrowthDeduction is made by the Software_Agent Sensor based on human observation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropGrowthObservation - a defined class that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of the irrig:ObservableProperty_Crop_Growth of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Crop. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the irrig:ObservableProperty_Crop_Growth to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Crop. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A CropGrowthObservation that made by the CatherineRoussey Sensor (human observation or biology sensor).

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropGrowthState - A qualitative value of the CropGrowth Property which changes over time, summarizing a set of information about that Property. To evaluate the State of the Property, some Boundaries are defined.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A State V2 is linked to an individual of  CropGrowth Property dedicated to maize crop. The V2 State is reached when two leaves are fully emerged with collars visible in a maize plant. The State appearance could be evaluated by human observation or by automatic method like the Growing Degree Unit (GDU).

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropWaterNeedDeduction - a defined class represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate a State of the irrig:ObservableProperty_Crop_WaterNeed of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Crop. The Observation may be performed by an inference engine. Links to a State to describe what the result is. Links to a TemporalEntity to indicate when the result is valid and for how many time.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A CropWaterNeedDeduction that made by the Software_Agent Sensor based on observations made by tensiometer sensor

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: CropWaterNeedState - A qualitative value of the CropWaterNeed Property which changes over time, summarizing a set of information about that Property. To evaluate the State of the Property, some Boundaries are defined.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: Example: The State No of the CropWaterNeed Property represents the fact that the crop does not need water. The State Yes of the CropWaterNeed Property represents the fact that the crop needs extra water.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: FeatureOfInterest_Air - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents air.

FeatureOfInterest_Crop - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents crop. The crop needs to be irrigated. 

In the example of Arvalis' dataset, the crop is maize that growth in an Arvalis' plot in 2013.
FeatureOfInterest_Rain - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents rain.
FeatureOfInterest_Rootzone - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents rootzone soil of a plant.
FeatureOfInterest_Soil30cmDepth - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents soil at 30cm depth.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Feature Of Interest Soi at 30cm Depth

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: FeatureOfInterest_Soil30cmDepth - an instance of the class sosa:FeatureOfInterest that represents soil at 60cm depth.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Feature Of Interest Soil at 60cm Depth

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: GrowthProperty - Growth aspect (characteristic dimension) of an entity representing the physical development or the increasing in amount, number or size of the entity. The Growth aspect of an entity is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity. The Growth quality values should be expressed by a qualitative value such as States or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: CropGrowth is a GrowthProperty representing the physical development of crop.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: IntensityProperty - Intensity aspect of an entity representing the strength effect or the level of power per unit area of the entity. The Intensity aspect of the entity is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity. The Intensity quality value should be expressed by a qualitative value such as States or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: RainIntensity is a IntensityProperty representing the strength effect of rain.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: IrrigationActuation - Act of carrying out an Irrigation (Actuation) Procedure to change the State of a Moisture ActuatableProperty of a Soil FeatureOfInterest using a watering Actuator. This act is performed during the context exploitation phase of a context aware system. Links to an Actuator to describe what made the Actuation and how; links to an ActuatableProperty to describe the target that the Actuation change; links to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with. When the act is performed based on a Deduction, it should be linked to this Deduction by the wasInfluencedBy property. Links to the Function that is triggered by the Actuation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: An IrrigationActuation is made by Watering Valve Actuator, links to Soil30cmDepth FeatureOfInterest and its Soil30cmDepthMoisture ActuatableProperty.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: MoistureProperty - Moisture aspect of an entity representing the amount of water available inside the entity. The Moisture aspect of the entity is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity. The Moisture quality value should be expressed by a qualitative value such as States or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: RootZoneMoistureLevel is a MoistureProperty representing the amount of water available around the soil’s root zone area of a plant.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_Air_MaxTemperaturePerDay - an instance of the class irrig:TemperatureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of max temperature per day of an air feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Air Max Temperature Per Day

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_Air_MinTemperaturePerDay - an instance of the class irrig:TemperatureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of min temperature per day of an air feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Air Min Temperature Per Day

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_Air_Temperature - an instance of the class irrig:TemperatureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of temperature of an air feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_Crop_Growth - an instance of the class irrig:GrowthProperty and caso:Property that represents the observable property of growth of a crop feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_Crop_Stage - an instance of the class irrig:GrowthProperty and caso:Property that represents the stage observable property of a crop feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_Crop_WaterNeed - an instance of the class irrig:StressProperty and caso:Property that represents the observable property of water need of an crop feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_Rain_Intensity - an instance of the class irrig:IntensityProperty and caso:Property that represents the intensity observable property of a rain feature of interest.
ObservableProperty_Rain_Quantity - an instance of the class irrig:AmountProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the quantity observable property of a rain feature of interest.

ObservableProperty_Rain_TotalQuantityPerDay - an instance of the class irrig:AmountProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of total quantity per day of a rain feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Rain Total Quantity Per Day

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_RootZone_AverageMoisturePerDay - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of average moisture per day of a root zone feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Root Zone Average Moisture Per Day

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_RootZone_MoistureLevel - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and caso:Property that represents the observable property of moisture level of a root zone feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Root Zone Moisture Level

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_Soil30cmDepth_AverageMoisturePerDay - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of average moisture per day of a soil 30cm depth feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Soil 30cm Depth Average Moisture Per Day

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_Soil30cmDepth_Moisture - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of moisture of a soil 30cm depth feature of interest.

ObservableProperty_Soil60cmDepth_AverageMoisturePerDay - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of average moisture per day of a soil 60cm depth feature of interest.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Observable Property Soil 60cm Depth Average Moisture Per Day

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: ObservableProperty_Soil60cmDepth_Moisture - an instance of the class irrig:MoistureProperty and sosa:ObservableProperty that represents the observable property of moisture of a soil 60cm depth feature of interest.
RainIntensityBoundary - Limit of a State of the RainIntensity Property. The value of the limit is a quantitative data. To store the value, the boundaryValue data property is used.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: 10 mm is the value of the Quantity_Low Boundary that distinguish the Light State from the Moderate State of the RainIntensity Property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainIntensityDeduction - a defined class that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate a State of the irrig:Observable_Rain_Intensity of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Rain. The Observation may be performed by an inference engine. Links to a State to describe what the result is. Links to a TemporalEntity to indicate when the result is valid and for how many time.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RainIntensityDeduction that made by the Software_Agent Sensor based on observations made by a pluviometer sensor

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainIntensityState - A qualitative value of the RainIntensity Property which changes over time, summarizing a set of information about that Property. To evaluate the State of the Property, some Boundaries are defined.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: Example: The State Light of the RainIntensity Property represents a fact that there is no enought rain to take any decision about irrigation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainQuantityObservation - a defined class that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of irrig:ObservableProperty_Rain_Quantity of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Rain. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the irrig:ObservableProperty_Rain_Quantity to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Rain. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RainQuantityObservation that made by the Pluviometer Sensor.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RainQuantityObservation - a defined that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of the irrig:ObservableProperty_Rain_TotalQuantityPerDay of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Rain. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the irrig:ObservableProperty_Rain_TotalQuantityPerDay to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Rain. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Rain Total Quantity Per Day Observation

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RainTotalQuantityPerDayObservation is computed by the SoftwareAgent Sensor based on observations made by a pluviometer.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RootZoneAverageMoisturePerDayObservation - a defined class that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of the irrig:ObservableProperty_RootZone_AverageMoisturePerDay  of the  irrig:FeatureOfInterest_RootZone. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the irrig:ObservableProperty_RootZone_AverageMoisturePerDay to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_RootZone. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Root Zone Moisture Per Day Observation

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RootZoneAverageMoisturePerDayObservation is computed by the SoftwareAgent Sensor.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RootZoneMoistureLevelBoundary - Limit of a State of the RootZoneMoistureLevel Property. The value of the limit is a quantitative data. To store the value, the boundaryValue data property is used.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: 10 cbar is the value of the Tension_VeryHigh Boundary that distinguish the Saturated State from the VeryHigh State of the RootZoneMoistureLevel Property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RootZoneMoistureLevelDeduction - a defined class represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate a State of the irrig:ObservableProperty_RootZone_MoistureLevel of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_RootZone. The Observation may be performed by an inference engine. Links to a State to describe what the result is. Links to a TemporalEntity to indicate when the result is valid and for how many time.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A RootZoneMoistureLevelDeduction that made by the Software_Agent.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: RootZoneMoistureLevelState - A qualitative value of the RootZoneMoistureLevel Property which changes over time, summarizing a set of information about that Property. To evaluate the State of the Property some Boundaries are defined.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: The State Saturated of the RootZoneMoistureLevel Property represents a fact that the moisture in rootzone is saturated in water.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Sensor_Pluviometer_01_Rain_Quantity - a pluviometer measures the rain quantity n° 01.
Sensor_Pluviometer_02_Rain_Quantity - a pluviometer measures the rain quantity n° 02.
Sensor_SoilTensiometer_01_Soil30cmDepth_Moisture - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 30 cm depth n° 01.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Sensor Soil Tensiometer 01 Soil 30cm Depth Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Sensor_SoilTensiometer_02_Soil30cmDepth_Moisture - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 30 cm depth n° 02.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Sensor Soil Tensiometer 02 Soil 30cm Depth Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Sensor_SoilTensiometer_03_Soil30cmDepth_Moisture - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 30 cm depth n° 03.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Sensor Soil Tensiometer 03 Soil 30cm Depth Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Sensor_SoilTensiometer_04_Soil60cmDepth_Moisture - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 60 cm depth n° 04.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Sensor Soil Tensiometer 04 Soil 60cm Depth Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Sensor_SoilTensiometer_05_Soil60cmDepth_Moisture - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 60 cm depth n° 05.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Sensor Soil Tensiometer 05 Soil 60cm Depth Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Sensor_SoilTensiometer_06_Soil60cmDepth_Moisture - a soil tensiometer measures the moisture at 60 cm depth n° 06.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Sensor Soil Tensiometer 06 Soil 60cm Depth Moisture

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Soil30cmDepthAverageMoisturePerDayObservation - a defined that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of the irrig:ObservableProperty_Soil30cmDepth_AverageMoisturePerDay of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Soil30cmDepth. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the irrig:ObservableProperty_Soil30cmDepth_AverageMoisturePerDay to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Soil30cmDepth. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Soil 30cm Depth Average Moisture Per Day Observation

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A Soil30cmDepthAverageMoisturePerDayObservation is computed by the SoftwareAgent Sensor.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Soil30cmDepthAverageMoisturePerDayObservation - a defined class represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of the irrig:ObservableProperty_Soil30cmDepth_MoisturePerDay of the  irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Soil30cmDepth. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the  irrig:ObservableProperty_Soil30cmDepth_MoisturePerDay to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Soil30cmDepth. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A Soil30cmDepthMoistureObservation is made by the SoilTensiometer_01 Sensor placed at 30 cm depth in the soil.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Soil60cmDepthAverageMoisturePerDayObservation - a defined class that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of the irrig:ObservableProperty_Soil60cmDepth_AverageMoisturePerDay of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Soil60cmDepth. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the irrig:ObservableProperty_Soil60cmDepth_AverageMoisturePerDay to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the  irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Soil60cmDepth. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Soil 60cm Depth Average Moisture Per Day Observation

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A Soil60cmDepthAverageMoisturePerDayObservation ismade by the SoftwareAgent Sensor.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Soil60cmDepthAverageMoisturePerDayObservation - an defined class that represents act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of the irrig:ObservableProperty_Soil60cmDepth_MoisturePerDay of the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Soil60cmDepth. This act can be performed during the context acquisition or context processing phases of a context aware system. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to the irrig:ObservableProperty_Soil60cmDepth_MoisturePerDay to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to the irrig:FeatureOfInterest_Soil60cmDepth. When the act is made during the context processing phase the entry values of the procedure should be linked to the Observation by the wasDerivedFrom property.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A Soil60cmDepthMoistureObservation is made by the Tensiometer Sensor placed at 60 cm depth in the soil.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_Crop_Growth_Init - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the state of crop growth is temporary undefined.
State_Crop_Growth_R1 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the “silking” stage. This stage is also named R1.
State_Crop_Growth_R1d15 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop 15 days after reaching the “silking” stage.
State_Crop_Growth_R5 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the “dent stage within kernel containing 50% moisture”. This stage is also named R5
State_Crop_Growth_R5hg45 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the “dent stage within kernel containing 45% moisture”.
State_Crop_Growth_V2 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the crop stage “5 leaves”, also named V2.
State_Crop_Growth_V7 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop after reaching the crop stage “10 leaves”, also named V7.
State_Crop_Growth_V7d20 - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop 20 days after reaching the stage “10 leaves”.
State_Crop_WaterNeed_No - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop does not need water.
State_Crop_WaterNeed_Wait - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop may need water soon.
State_Crop_WaterNeed_Yes - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the crop needs water.
State_Crop_WaterNeed_Init - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the state of crop water need is temporary undefined.
State_Rain_Intensity_Heavy - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the rain intensity is heavy.
State_Rain_Intensity_Init - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the rain intensity is temporary undefined.
State_Rain_Intensity_Light - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the rain intensity is light.
State_Rain_Intensity_Moderate - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the rain intensity is moderate.
State_RootZone_MoistureLevel_Average - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the average state.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Average

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_RootZone_MoistureLevel_Dry - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the dry state.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Dry

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_RootZone_MoistureLevel_High - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the high state.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level High

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_RootZone_MoistureLevel_Init - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is temporary undefined.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Init

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_RootZone_MoistureLevel_Low - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the low state.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Low

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_RootZone_MoistureLevel_Saturated - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the saturated state.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Saturated

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_RootZone_MoistureLevel_VeryHigh - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the very high state.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Very High

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: State_RootZone_MoistureLevel_VeryLow - an instance of the class caso:State that represents the root zone moisture level is at the very low state.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: State Root Zone Moisture Level Very Low

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: StressProperty - Stress aspect of an entity representing the pressure inside the entity. The Stress aspect of the entity is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity. The Stress quality values should be expressed by a qualitative value such as States or by a quantitative value.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: CropWaterNeed is a StressProperty representing the stress inside the plant when it needs extra water. It corresponds to the drought stress.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: TemperatureProperty - Temperature aspect of an entity representing the measure of how hot or cold of the entity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A sensor that measures the rain fall.
A sensor that measures the soil moisture.
A sensor that measure weather conditions.
An actuator that open the water valve.
A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device)
A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device)
A relationship providing the name of an entity (e.g., device)
